etymologies: Old English tā, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch teen and German Zeh, Zehe. Current senses of the verb date from the mid 19th century

definitions: any of the five digits at the end of the human foot

examples.text: he cut his big toe on a sharp stone

shortDefinitions: any of five digits at end of human foot

definitions: any of the digits of the foot of a quadruped or bird.
shortDefinitions: any of digits of foot of quadruped or bird

definitions: the part of an item of footwear that covers a person's toes

examples.text: socks that were holed at the toes

shortDefinitions: part of item of footwear that covers person's toes

definitions: the lower end, tip, or point of something.
shortDefinitions: lower end, tip, or point of something

definitions: the tip of the head of a golf club, furthest from the shaft.
shortDefinitions: tip of head of golf club

definitions: the foot or base of a cliff, slope, or embankment

examples.text: valley widening and river meandering have eroded the toe of the slopes and caused new landslides

definitions: a flattish portion at the foot of an otherwise steep curve on a graph

examples.text: the contrast potential of the printing is indicated by the steepness of the curve from shoulder to toe

shortDefinitions: flattish portion at foot of otherwise steep curve on graph

definitions: a section of a rhizome or similar fleshy root from which a new plant may be propagated.
shortDefinitions: section of rhizome or similar fleshy root from which new plant may be propagated

definitions: push, touch, or kick (something) with one's toe

examples.text: he toed off his shoes and flexed his feet

notes.text: with object and usually with adverbial

shortDefinitions: push, touch, or kick with one's toe

definitions: strike (the ball) with the toe of the club.
shortDefinitions: strike ball with toe of club

definitions: walk with the toes pointed in (or out)

examples.text: he toes out when he walks

definitions: (of a pair of wheels) converge (or diverge) slightly at the front

examples.text: on a turn, the inner wheel toes out more

shortDefinitions: (of pair of wheels) converge or diverge slightly at front
